function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Faster diffusion of knowledge among academics may facilitate mitigation strategies, increasing the risk of infection spread.","Impact":"Higher potential for rapid spread of infection within academic communities and beyond.","Mitigation":"Implement strict health and safety protocols for academic interactions and emphasize the importance of vaccination and testing.","Technologies":"Health monitoring technologies and contact tracing systems for academic environments.","People":"Academics, students, researchers, and the general population in proximity to academic communities.","Owner":"Education institutions, public health organizations, and government authorities."},{"Description":"Industry share of the workforce may indicate a lack of opportunities for remote work, potentially favoring the occurrence of infection within the workforce.","Impact":"Increased risk of infection transmission among workers who cannot work from home.","Mitigation":"Promote and support remote work options, improve workplace hygiene, and provide adequate protective equipment for on-site workers.","Technologies":"Remote work infrastructure, workplace sanitation technologies, and personal protective equipment.","People":"Workers in industries with low remote work opportunities, employers, and regulatory bodies.","Owner":"Employers, government bodies, and public health organizations."},{"Description":"Immigration for humanitarian reasons variable may indicate a diverse population with varying levels of flexibility in work arrangements and living conditions, posing potential infection spread challenges.","Impact":"Higher probability of infection spread among diverse immigrant populations, including those in unfavorable work conditions and collective accommodations.","Mitigation":"Provide support for immigrants in terms of health education, access to flexible work options, and improved living conditions.","Technologies":"Multilingual health communication technologies, remote work tools, and community health outreach platforms.","People":"Immigrants in humanitarian situations, community leaders, and public health advocates.","Owner":"Nonprofit organizations, community support groups, and government agencies."}]}
